page.title: 19HOUSING
page.content: {BUILDINGS - MOBBERLEY AREA. } {HISTORICAL HOUSES. } There are many fine old houses in this area all of which have interesting histories. BREACH HOUSE. In the church register it is recorded that Margaret Duncalfe of Breach House married Robert Burgess of Warford in 1578. The house may have been named after a William Bruch or Breech who was Church Warden in 1606. The house has been derelict for some time now. HANSON HOUSE. John and Mary Hanson built the house after buying the land from the Earl of Shrewbury in 1631. One document from the house tells of a John Bradshaw of Bradshaw Hall, Disley. He was a sergeant at Law at Chester Assizes under Oliver Cromwell and was connected with the regicide of Charles I.
